text:
="preserve">Keyhole Markup Language is a file format for displaying data on maps.
In the same way that a Web browser displays web pages written with HTML, KML draws data on maps like Google Maps and virtual globes like Google Earth.
It is an international standard [http://www.opengeospatial.org/standards/kml/], maintained by the Open Geospatial Consortium [http://www.opengeospatial.org/].
Google, the previous maintainers of the specification, have information on writing KML on their [http://code.google.com/apis/kml/ website].
